alert.note: Alert for Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 01 at 3:48PM AKDT until June 01 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Red Flag Warning Wed PM north of the Chatanika River... Northern Alaska will remain mainly warmer than normal and dry through the week. Red Flag conditions will occur through 10 PM tonight in Zones 220, 221 North of the Tanana River, and 222 north of the Chatanika River with west winds of 15 to 20 mph combined with RH 15-25% and temperatures near 80. Areas south of the Chatanika River and Tanana River will have slightly less wind speed, but will be hot and dry. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING FOR MIDDLE TANANA VALLEY... * AFFECTED AREA...North of the Chatanika River. * TIMING...From Noon to 10 PM. * WINDS...West 15 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. * HUMIDITY...As low as 20 percent. * TEMPERATURES...75 to 80. * IMPACTS...Rapid ignition, growth and spread of fires will be possible.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that conditions are occurring or will occur which could lead to the development of large and dangerous fires. It is directed toward fire agencies, and through them, to the public. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
